name: antsama
text: That's the most angry stop-at-a-stop-sign ever.

name: jesler729
text: Roast Beef just furiously looks in both directions to make sure no cars are coming.

name: nsrdude
text: He needs to be 100% sure.

name: luckyg
text:
LOOK LEFT
LOOK RIGHT
OKAY GO

name: saint
text: that's DAMNIT! NO CARS ON MY LEFT. DAMNIT! NO CARS ON THE RIGHT! FUCK YOU! GO!

name: rainwolfj
text: Ironically he looks right then left, both of you are charged 5 awesome points for not understanding perspective.  But I can't stay mad at saint.

name: sp1derbaby
text: You are charged 5 awesome points for not understanding irony but win it all back in the awesome avatar race and get the girl in the end.

name: gamemeister27
text: That got me in an accident when some dumb teen girl on her cell phone came roaring around the corner (up a hill) at 60 MPH from my left. I looked left first, that was my mistake.

name: dj_douche
text: Also, when inside the Volvo of despair, Ray assumes the same style of speech as Beef, as denoted by smaller font and lack of punctuation

name: shutup_shutup
text: The font of despair.

name: kickstart
text: Inside the fount of despair.

name: soticoto
text: Tapping straight into the well of circumstances.

name: nsrdude
text: A comment left by nsrdude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by enough_talk, Ariamaki, Boxus, PoodleLucy, aperson)

name: riazm
text:
I think the personality modifier of choice in Acheworld is definitely a crispy J.

Who needs visuals when the market is flooded with Mexican magical realism?

name: morypcaina
text: what is this J? I know what salvia is. but a wikipedia search for "J" did not help

name: leahpidoptera
text: A J is a joint, good sir. :)

name: atticusonline
text: I hope people googled saliva instead of salvia.

name: spicyponyhead
text: you had to do a wikipedia search for a drug reference. I see what you did there.

name: leia
text: I would argue that it is booze, actually.

name: philosophe
text: Oooh. A bad trip on sally D would be... Bad. That shit's intense.

name: saru
text: A good trip on sally D can be pretty bad. That shit is really intense.

name: jlaw
text: really? everyone i know who has tried it has been less than impressed

name: philosophe
text: You gotta use at least 20x extract, a large bong, and one of the torch lighters. Burn it all in one huge hit and hold for 30  seconds.

name: tellumo
text: And then you end up looking like your icon?

name: cryztal
text:
True facts.

With this method, though, there is no such thing as a good trip. there is only, "OMFG HOW DID I BECOME A KITTEN WITH FKS? NOOOOOOOOO."

name: soticoto
text: Synergy-chub.

name: zeal
text: I've had a salvia downturn.  Otherwise innocuous experiences gave way to a howling journey into the abyss, culminating in a birds-eye view of a post-apocalyptic nightmare world.  A mountainside coated in bones, and the flensed metal of naked skyscrapers rising like shattered fingerbones into the sky.  The golden sun beamed down merrily upon the wreckage of all man's works.

name: stoatlad
text: I have decided to try and paint this.

name: invidious
text: I'm confused: is this an argument for or against?

name: carlyle
text: Both!

name: zeal
text: I've enjoyed some salvia in my time, and I've never gotten angry on it. My roommate, however, was transported to a viking longship one time. Apparently, while in the grip of his vision he saw me at the prow in full Viking apparel, bellowing at the storm.

name: tfaironpirate
text: Dude, my friend thought he was a lamb. For like, two days. Something was wrong in his head, the drug was like, long gone out of his system, and yet, still, a lamp he was.

name: elsewhere
text: Wait, was he a Lamb or a Lamp?? Inquiring minds need to know!

name: tfaironpirate
text:
A mystery that with all our science we may never know.

But yeah, a lamp.

There is really no excuse, the B and P keys are like, polar opposites.

name: cryztal
text:
One time, my dogg smoked salvia and he was utterly convinced that he was a one-celled organism trapped in a two dimensional plane for the rest of his life .

When I tried it five months later, I just thought things were purple and tried to claw at rocks.

name: rubber_baron
text: WHY FIND OUT

name: andyk
text: one of the best story arcs... i give it 5 just for being a part of it.

name: nsrdude
text: Agreed. That = truth.

name: tristanhw
text: AWESOME ARC. One of the best strips of this arc, except where ray throws up in his mouth just looking at roast beef.......

name: rad-chillies
text: this arc really captures the logic of bad trips

name: relaxing
text: covered in hope, and vaseline / still cannot fix this broken machine

name: mygoodfriend
text: That Volvo really did a number on those two. NO GETTING AROUND THAT

name: arthurdentlives
text:
NO GETTING AROUND THAT

really

name: beansdooma
text: A BLAA BLOOO BAHHH WE MISSED THE ENTRANCE BLOO BLAH

name: the_doz
text: A blubberin' chubby for you sir.

name: semiquaver
text: This strip is so right I mean there's no getting around that THERE'S NO GETTING AROUND THAT

name: jlaw
text: This was the strip that hooked me

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs

Mr. Bear: Trial run of the cooking program.

Today's Blogs

Ray: Did I get a job at Taco Bell? Yes.
Teodor: Cooking show playalong

name: i_love_kate
text: I love how Teodor and Cornelius' accounts of the incident clash ever so slightly.

name: stormagnet
text:
In a weird, self-projection kind of way, I feel kind of happy for Beef in panel 4. It seems like kind of a marker in his character development, though more subdued than the "I am the LAW and I am the LASH" moment.
Like there's a progression from thinking, "this is Just How Things Are" to "it's My Fault" to "My parents did a number on me."

name: direhaggis
text:
Dialogue bubble on right side of face: sad, sad times
Dialogue bubble on left side of face: mad as hell

name: mattylite
text: Onstad has a way of making fast food signs look really creepy.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: mustakrakesh
text: One of my favorites, one chubby for you sir!

name: daedala_x
text: man, being seen crying in a car is always hell of embarrassing. it's a really private moment, like masturbating or eating an extra long cheese coney from sonic's without any napkins.

name: apricotta
text: Sitting in the Volvo of Despair makes Ray talk in a smaller font.

name: madrin
text: oh my god this whole strip is constantly fucking funny.

name: nonanon
text: Only thing that could make this better is a panel of Ray with nothin' but "A BLOO BLOO BLOO!"

name: mojowo11
text:
RIP Nine Inch Nails

I had hell of love for your tunes.

name: gigs
text: you do know that trent reznor is not dead and has gone on hiatus from making music before, right?

name: moophl
text: This is not a Volvo 244 by the way, the last figure in the model number of old volvos denotes the amount of doors. This is a 242. (The station wagon is called 245.)

name: siliconslick
text: i noticed this as well.

name: terriblerobot
text: I was going to make this exact comment. Chubby for you

name: greenkoolayd
text: guendis

name: duperando
text: I love how even in the volvo of despair, Roast Beef still stops and looks both ways at a stop sign.

name: shinkusan
text: It is sad that this comic basically encapsulates how 90% of my past girlfriends dealt with problems. All "I CAN'T HANDLE YOU BEING MAD AT ME" and "I'M HAVING A PANIC ATTACK" and then "I CAN'T TALK ABOUT IT BECAUSE I AM TOO SAD ABOUT IT."
